body_html:
It is possible to avoid the instability by running the dynamic_rnn/while_loop with parallel_iterations=1 ... at the risk of reducing performance.
…

(I note that this specific training instability, in my case, was not dropout, but augmentation, though.) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
It is possible to avoid the instability by running the
dynamic_rnn/while_loop with parallel_iterations=1 ... at the risk of
reducing performance.

On Sat, Dec 23, 2017 at 5:42 PM, Joshua Wise <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Again, sad to hear of it being closed from aging out. (I note that this
> specific training instability, in my case, was not dropout, but
> augmentation, though.)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
